result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor Christopher Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 bond applied. Balance to be paid within 60 days

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor Christopher Roth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Taylor Christopher Roth in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14TR1846 tracking with:
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant and an offer was provided.  Defendant would like to accept one of the offers.    
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
Pay fine and costs = $442.00
bond to be applied.

14TR1846 is to be put on the Trial calendar

Defendant Taylor Christopher Roth in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that on February 9th the defendant wished to get counsel.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant called his office and wanted to speak with him but he was informed that he would have to waive counsel on the record before that was done.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to waive his right to Attorney.  Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver.

BY THE COURT:  Reset one more time for Return and set pre-trial.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on March 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Taylor Christopher Roth in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14TR1846 tracking with:
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  
BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to get a PD.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
Defendant is to get an Attorney before the Return Date.  Return date scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
